message:
Geeks,

Out of mere curiosity, I'd like to know your thoughts on the Apple iOS backdoor story. 

I personally think it's purely a trust building feat more than anything else. Especially because most of the companies that backed Apple in the backdoor issue, are involved in PRISM: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PRISM_(surveillance_program) - Microsoft, Fb, and Google were among the first to back Apple's position against the FBI, and they're all in there, including Apple of course.

I understand that a backdoor would be a whole other level of wtf, but I would still not be very trusting of them from a privacy POV, if at all.

Thoughts?
story: Mohamed Tarek El Haddad shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: PRISM (surveillance program) - Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
caption: en.wikipedia.org
description: PRISM is a clandestine[1]surveillance program under which the United States National Security Agency (NSA) collects internet communications from at least nine major US internet companies.[2][3][4] Since 2001 the United States government has increased its scope for such surveillance, and so this prog…

data.message: Its definitely good business sense, but now the FBI says there's a third party that can hack the phone, which sounds like pretty bad news for Apple
